definition: to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
surname Zha
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
see 山查[shan1 zha1]
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: Judicial accounting technology is a specialism means to investigate and prosecute economic crime case.
sentences.chinese: 司法会计技术是查办经济犯罪案件的专门手段。

sentences.english: Criminal punishment has been intensified, and a batch of big and vital cases have been dealt with.
sentences.chinese: 强化刑事打击，查办了一批大案要案。

sentences.english: Xie one month ago participated and assisted the investigation of corruption against the county's Deputy Secretary.
sentences.chinese: 谢一个月前参与协助查办该县副书记贪腐案。

sentences.english: The corrupt mayor should be removed from office and prosecuted.
sentences.chinese: 这个腐化堕落的市长应当撤职查办。

sentences.english: This company has been stopped for an audit because of its messy management and tolerance of misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司管理混乱藏污纳垢，已经停业查办了。

sentences.english: Chinese law and judicial organs shall punish intervention units.
sentences.chinese: 中国法律与司法机关单位应介入查办。

definition: wrongdoing/failure to do one's duty
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to conclude a case/to wind up
to oversee/to supervise/superintendent
to investigate thoroughly
to transfer (a case, a person, files etc)
to seize/to apprehend/an arrest
to punish
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
to handle a case
case/instance/CL:宗[zong1],樁|桩[zhuang1],起[qi3]
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
to punish (someone)/to take disciplinary action against (someone)
